item.title: By: David Bick
item.dc:creator: David Bick
item.content:encoded:
Phil: We’ve worked hard to make it as secure as possible, but I agree that a hosted service won’t be for everyone. We won’t be retiring the on-premise version any time soon ðŸ˜‰

And one small correction — the relay service doesn’t need to be installed on the server you’re monitoring. A nearby server is fine, so long as it can see the machines you want to monitor and has access to the internet.

(Obvious disclosure: I work for Red Gate on SQL Monitor.)

item.title: By: Phil Hegedusich
item.dc:creator: Phil Hegedusich
item.content:encoded:
Sounds like a great product, Jes, but my database servers don’t connect to the Internet. Ever. For any reason.

Oh, and “install a relay service on the server you wish to monitor” is also a deal breaker.

It could be because I work at a bank.
